summary: The Wounded Warrior Bill of Rights Act of 2025 clarifies and strengthens accountability for injured or ill members of the Armed Forces undergoing medical separation through the Integrated Disability Evaluation System (IDES). It emphasizes the responsibility of the military chain of command in determining fitness for duty, ensuring due process, and upholding the rights of Wounded Warriors. The bill mandates updates to IDES policies, including a hearing process within the military command structure for appeals, and requires a briefing to Congress on implementation progress.
